subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Grants and Non-Dilutive Funding
description: A quick, practical guide to Grants and Non-Dilutive Funding.

hook.text: Tesla received a $465M government loan in 2010. They repaid it earlyâ€”and kept 100% of their equity.

buildup.text: Non-dilutive funding means money that doesn't cost you ownership: grants, loans, tax credits.

discovery.text: Government grants (SBIR, Innovate UK) fund R&D in exchange for advancing national priorities.

twist.text: Grant applications are slow and bureaucratic. Some founders spend months applying for $50K.

climax.text: For deep-tech and biotech, grants can fund years of research that VCs won't touch yet.

punchline.text: Free money exists. It just takes patience to find it.

quiz.question: What is non-dilutive funding?
options: Capital that doesn't require giving up ownershipâ€”like grants, loans, and tax credits
Funding that comes with zero strings attached
